intro: Isopogon tripartitus var. plurilobus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed banksia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and distinctive cylindrical inflorescences. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean-type climates. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native habitat.
